newTests.testBehavior: sub method with two identical numbers
newTests.methodSignatureFromSource: public static int sub(int num1, int num2)
newTests.inDepthDescription: This test verifies the behavior of the sub method when both input numbers are identical. It ensures that the subtraction of two equal numbers results in zero, which is a fundamental property of subtraction.

newTests.testBehavior: main method with a single valid argument
newTests.newTestMethod:
def "main method with a single valid argument"() {
    when:
    String[] args = ["5"]
    Calc.main(args)

    then:
    thrown(ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException)
}
newTests.inDepthDescription: This test checks the behavior of the main method when provided with only one argument. Since the main method expects two arguments, this test ensures that an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown, confirming that the method correctly handles cases where the required number of arguments is not met.
